channel.title: Formula 1 news - Autosport
channel.description: Stay up to date with the latest Formula 1 news from Autosport.

item.title: Wolff: Mercedes F1 team boss role 'taking its toll'
item.description: Mercedes boss Toto Wolff says his long stretch as a Formula 1 team principal is 'taking its toll' on him, but he will stay on with the team in 2020.

item.title: Vettel confirmed at Aston Martin for 2021 F1 season
item.description: Sebastian Vettel has been confirmed as a driver for the rebranded Aston Martin team for the 2021 Formula 1 season

item.title: Perez to leave Racing Point at the end of 2020 F1 season
item.description: Sergio Perez has announced he will leave Racing Point at the end of the 2020 Formula 1 season, paving the way for Sebastian Vettel to join the team

item.title: Ferrari reveals 1000th GP celebration livery for F1 Tuscan GP
item.description: Ferrari has revealed its celebratory livery for its 1,000th Formula 1 grand prix at Mugello this weekend

item.title: Bottas sees no consolation in closing F1 points gap to Hamilton
item.description: Valtteri Bottas sees no consolation in slightly closing the Formula 1 points gap to Lewis Hamilton at the Italian Grand Prix, as he viewed the weekend as a lost opportunity

item.title: Seidl: Racing Point still favourites for third in F1 championship
item.description: McLaren team boss Andreas Seidl believes that Racing Point is still favourite for third place in the Formula 1 constructors' championship, citing the "pure car potential" of the RP20

item.title: Mercedes takes steps to stop Monza F1 pitlane gaffe repeat
item.description: Mercedes has taken steps to ensure it doesn't repeat the mistake of missing the pitlane closed message which netted Lewis Hamilton a penalty in the Formula 1 Italian Grand Prix

item.title: Imola plans to sell 13,000 tickets for return F1 race
item.description: Imola is hoping to sell 13,000 tickets when Formula 1 returns to the venue for the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix on 1 November

item.title: Renault prefers F1 "partner" teams for supply deal over customers
item.description: Renault is interested in supplying other Formula 1 teams with engines in the future, but only if they become a 'partner' of the French car manufacturer rather than a customer.

item.title: Binotto: Ferrari F1 still not in a crisis despite double DNF at Monza
item.description: Ferrari is still not facing a crisis despite its double retirement from the Italian Grand Prix and recent poor form, according to Formula 1 team principal Mattia Binotto

item.title: Gasly "would never have expected" Monza F1 win after Red Bull drop
item.description: Pierre Gasly says he "never expected" what has happened since his demotion from Red Bull just over one year ago, having now scored his maiden Formula 1 win at Monza.

item.title: Mercedes: Lack of F1 engine modes hindered Italian GP fightback
item.description: Mercedes Formula 1 chief Toto Wolff acknowledged the FIA's ban on engine mode changes hindered both Lewis Hamilton and Valtteri Bottas' fightback drives at the Italian Grand Prix

item.title: Williams names Simon Roberts as acting F1 team principal
item.description: The Williams Formula 1 team has named Simon Roberts as acting team principal for its "transition period" after the Williams family stood down following the Italian Grand Prix

item.title: Williams CEO O'Driscoll to retire after F1 team's sale
item.description: Outgoing Williams CEO Mike O'Driscoll has announced his intention to retire following the sale of the Formula 1 team

item.title: The Ferrari model that is behind Alpine's F1 push
item.description: Enzo Ferrari made no secret of the fact that he only ever set up his road car operation so it could help fund his Formula 1 team
